English: With our rise to glory and our succesfull campaign in north Africa we should now go either east or west
A Last Crusade

The holy land languishes under the Turkish Yoke. Fellow Christians from Beirut to Jaffa are under the Sultans Jackboot. But no more! With Europe stronger than ever, now is our opportunity to set the score with the Turk once and for all! We shall demand the Sultan to surrender all territories of the Holy land immediately, and if not, we shall call for the last crusade!
A Last Crusade?

An emissary from the pope has come, demanding all territories along the Levantine coast be surrendered immediately. If we do not acquiesce, they threaten to call a crusade. Is this a legitimate threat?
The Turks agree!
Unbelievable news! The Sultan has agreed! This is a glorious day for all Christians!
Call for the Last Crusade
The Turks have, as expected, laughed away our demands. But we could be the last ones laughing. Do we call for the crusade, your holiness, or shall we call this mistake away?
A Last Crusade?

Strange news comes from Rome: The Pope has called for a new crusade! While this may be just more rambling from an institution on the death knell, humiliating the Turks is an appetizing goal. But is prestige worth that much to send our men overseas?
European invasion of the Levant
The Europeans are beating back the Turks! While stabbing fellow Muslims may be a dishonest move, the seizure of the Holy cities is a prize we cannot pass!
Wonderful news from Rome:
A Last Crusade! The Pope has called for a new crusade! Finally, our mission is within grasp again!
Defeat in the Levant

Disaster! With weak support from fellow Christians, The Ottomans rallying their nation with a call for Jihad, and military failures, we have been beaten from the Holy land again. Now, where do we go from here?
Defeat in the Levant
Disaster! With weak support from the Empire, The Pope rallying fellow Europeans, and military failures, we have been beaten from the Holy land. Now, where do we go from here?
Victory in the Levant
Praise God! We have seized Jerusalem! As Papal soldiers march into Jerusalem, fellow Christians rejoice in happiness!  This is a glorious day for all Christians!
Victory in the Levant
Praise God! We have beaten back the Crusaders! The prestige of the Empire has been strengthened, and the Sultan is more respected than ever!  This is a glorious day for all Muslims!
Victory in the Levant
Praise God! We have seized Jerusalem! The prestige of the Papal state has been strengthened, and the Pope is more popular than ever!  This is a glorious day for all Christians!
Guangseo seizes Guangdong!

Upon the death of our governor-general for Guangdong, Pak Yeong-hyeon, our dysfunctional court has been struggling to decide on a candidate for the next governor-general. Seizing this opportunity, It seems that the king of Guangseo has appointed his choice for governor, under the pretext of giving his advice. Though infuriating that our subordinate would just nominate a loyalist to him, his choice seems to be popular with the people. The court has bickered the opportunity for intervention away.
Guangseo is now under our control

Upon the death of the governor-general for Guangdong, Pak Yeong-hyeon, we have managed to secure our candidate for the new governor-general! As according to the secret deal, he is now under our control and will tie Guangdong to Guangseo even further.
Bokgun Seizes Gangseo!

The maritime province of Bokgun has traditionaly produced great merchant families, and the king of Bokgun has used them to his benefit. Today, it is revealed that their influence stretches further than expected. The governor-general of Gangseo has appointed new ministers for the province without even informing us, apparently under the advice of the merchant clique. It seems that yet another province has escaped our control.
Gangseo buckles!
The governor-general of Gangseo has appointed all of our demands!This is a glorious day, and our influence grows even further!
Un-Gui seizes Seongdo!

The unthinkable has happened. Troops from Un-Gui have just seized the capital Seongdo of Sichuan from us! Our administration seems to have fled without even a fight, and it seems like the peasants are joining the rebels. This is the most brazen attack on our authority in decades, and we need something to be done.
Guizhou has been captured!

Our troops have seized Guiyang. The plan went better than expected, and the local farmers are greeting us as liberators. However, this move will have consequences. Consequences that we have been preparing for years. Now we strike, for the liberation of China!
War with the Feudatories!

The Feudatories have been growing since their establishment, and it seems that they think they can finally strike against the Tiger. And we will teach them a lesson that they shall never forget. Those three "kings" shall be hanged in a few weeks!
Our claims on Xikang

The Buyeo empire crumbles in the east. This is a great opportunity to assert our claims on Xikang, and finally unite all Tibetans under our rightful rule! We must be quick and assert our control on the entire region
French: Then, the weak Buyeo would realize that dislodging us from Xikang would be more trouble than leaving us. Onwards to Kham!

English: Our claims on Dehong

The Buyeo empire crumbles in the east, and our loyal Kachin subjects have petitioned us to unite their people and take Dehong for ourselves! As benevolent rulers, we must of course answer their call. The rich Jade from the nearby regions is, of course, a welcome addition.
The second Vietnamese Rebellion!

Disaster! As soon as our troops have left for the northern frontlines, Vietnamese separatist rebels are attacking our garrison left and right! This is a grave danger to our kingdom, and actions need to be taken immediately. Or else, we could lose it all.
All contacts to Formosa have been lost!

Grave news from Formosa: The tribal aborigines have sacked the provincial capital of Kaohsiung City. Our administration has been decapitated, and our merchants have hurridly escaped to the mainland. We need to restore order immediately.
The pacification of the south

The three rebelling Feudatories have been reconqueared, and their kings have been executed. The Chinese now fear us once more, and their rebellious spirit has been beaten down. All rumours of the empire declining have been silenced, and the future looks brighter than ever. A truly glorious day for the Empire
Victories from the frontlines

As the empire's dogs flee north, we have secured all lands south of the Yangtse. Their emissaries carry the news of surrender, and we will force our demands upon them. Now, our reign is secure, free from the heedings of the false Emperor!
Final victory

Today, the guns are silent. The empire retreats north of the Yangtse, and a prominent commander has been agreed upon to administer the lands of Chu as a buffer state between the free kingdoms. This is a glorious day for the Chinese!
An Unbelievable defeat

What went wrong? How could have this happened? We have completely lost to our formal vassals, and all lands south of the Yangtse has been lost. Can we rule over our uppity subjects any longer? Can we even claim the title of the Emperor of China? We need answers now, and we need them quick.
A raid on Akmolinsk

All reports from the Akmolinsk krai indicate the Kazakhs have launched a raid against our colonists. Buildings have been damaged, and the empire's prestige is tarnished. We shall ride to Kazakhstan to subdue the rowdy hordes once and for all!
The porous border with Bukkhara

After the annexation of the Juz, we thought our troubles with the hordes were over. It wasn't. Gangs, smugglers, and criminals cross over the porous border with Bukkhara, and our citizens are suffering. We will march to Bishkek and let the Khan learn the lesson for such crimes.
The Investigation of Western Ships

While our quest to install our rule in Taiwan continues, one significant issue has slipped outside of our control. Our officials investigating the western merchants whom have supplied the Taiwanese with armaments apparently have gone quite overboard, and have killed Venetian sailors in a Scottish vessel. Both states are now demanding apologies-but do we follow their requests?
An incident in Taiwan

After their pacification of Taiwan, the Buyeo have been more and more brazen in regulating our ships-and one incident has crossed the line. Apparently, Buyeo officials have killed Venetian sailors in a Scottish Opium merchants vessel suspected of supplying weapons! Our population wants revenge, and our navy can deliver. But are we down to the level where we go to war for an opium merchants loss?
Start a civil war
The English lands are divided between two nations and there can only be on nation ruling all the English lands we shall unite it.
Start the English Civil War!
Scotland is giving us supplies!
Scotland is giving us supplies while we're short on them due to this civil war.
Nice
The Aztecs wants to be friends with us.
We do share a common enemy, the Genoense but do we trust them?
Yes, we shall be allies with the Aztecs
We should just stay on our own.
The Sale of Bergen

A pericular offer has reached us from the Kalmar custom union. The demand is the port of Bergen, and the offer is 50,000 livres. While this is certainly a steep price for such a port, we must also consider the geopolitical consequences. Do we accept the offer?
Return of Nieuw Hague

Located on the mouth of the Mississippi River, the port of Nieuw Hague is one of the most strategic cities in North America. Since its loss to the Freilanders, our economy has been limited and our maritime industry has collapsed. Now that we have recovered the city, our glory can begin anew!
Demands from the metropolitan

We have traditionaly tried to convert our Ruthenians to the one true Catholic faith. No more, it seems. A letter from the Metropolitan of Kiev demands that freedom for his flock be allowed, or else. While the demands are harsh, if Russia intervenes with this, it could get worse.
Metropolitan of Kiev requests military aid
The Metropolitan of Kiev has sent us requests of military aid, offering us the loyalty of the Ruthenians if we can free them from the Lithuanians. How can we refuse such offers?
Triumph over the Lithuanians
With our troops marching into Lithuania, the Grand duke has sent us offers of peace. Now, we can assert our dominion over the Ruthenians.
The Loss of the East
The unthinkable has happened. Most of Ruthenia has been lost, and our troops are decimated. We may have only one option left: the Polish. But are we that desparate?
Offers from the East

After their defeat from the Ruthenian rebels, the Lithuanians have come to us for protection. They suggest a union between us two, and promise loyalty and prosperity. A hundred wars couldn't have acheived today's offers!
Victory over Ruthenia
Victory! The Tsar's armies have been defeated, and now we own Kiev once more. The metropolitan has been exiled, and a new loyal one has been elected. Now, peace may finaly be achieved again.
Defeat in the Dneiper
The Dneiper runs red with Russian blood. Our foolish attempts over the Ruthenians have devastated our armies. Can we recover from this?
Loss of connection to South Ruthenia

As Russia marches east, our hold of Ruthenia weakens day by day. And today, we may have completely lost it. As Russia has cleaved our nation in half, the Southern Ruthenian portion of our lands have declared independence! As we have lost all means to deal with the rebellion, it seems that our only option is to watch. How much longer can we even remain as an independent nation?
Lithuania proper lost!

All lands that we have considered to be propper Lithuanian have been wrested from our control. The vast majority of our people now are Ruthenyans. This cannot continue. It is time we initiate some radical reforms to our nation, or else we wouldn't survive.
Lithuanian Collapse

Ever since the loss of Lithuania proper, Lithuania was in constant political turmoil. The vast majority of the nation was Ruthenyan, whom did not identify as Lithuanians. Now two Ruthenian states rises from the Ashes, and the nearby nations have taken their slice.
The Altai question

Ever since the treaty of Nerchinsk, the Altai region has always been in our interest. Rich in Gold, Silver and Copper, the only blocking factor stopping our prospectors has been the Altai Uriankhai host and the Buyeo overlords. However, a brewing leadership crisis has posed an opportunity for us. \n\n The Altai host has lost its Noyon and the Tuvan horde seek to expand their terf. Standard horde shenanigans. But the fact that some Taijis of the Uriankhai have asked us for help changes everything. If we intervene now, this means war with the Buyeo. But this might be an opportunity to further expand our interests, especially in the TransBaikal region. Do we intervene?
The Altai question

News from the Altai mountains have shocked the court. Apparently, the Tuvans have layed claim to the Altai Uriankhai's lands-and the Uriankhai have asked the Russians for help before us! Although the Tuvan arrogance needs to be punished, the first and formost question is how to deal with the Russians. Do we acknowledge their influence over the Altai region, or do we risk war?
Buyeo demands
The Buyeo have demanded us to leave the Altai region immediately. Do we buckle, or do we use this opportunity to claim the Baikal region from the Mongol host once and for all?
The Buyeo approve our actions!

Unexpected news from the South has come. Apparently, the Buyeo approve of our actions and agree to punish the Tuvan intrusion! While the diplomats try to cover the reality in as pompous terms as possible, all political advisors agree that this is just an acknowledgement of their loss of control. The Altai is ours!
The Russians evacuate the Altai!
As expected, the Northern barbarians have evacuated the Altai! The Empire celebrates today!
Lake Balkash trading rights

Large, narrow, and slightly saline, lake Balkash has always been a trading hub for the nomads roaming eastern Kazakhstan. Since we have annexed the Juz, our traders have regularly visited the cities around the lake. Apparently, that seems to have angered the locals. \n\n A few weeks ago, reports emerged that the local Khoshut Oirat population has murdered three Russian traders. The nation is enraged, and demands immediate retaliation. Should we send our demands of trading rights around Lake Balkash to the Buyeo?!
Lake Balkash trading rights

Large, narrow, and slightly saline, lake Balkash has always been a trading hub for the nomads roaming eastern Kazakhstan. Since the Russians annexed the Juz, Russian traders have regularly visited the cities around the lake. Apparently, that seems to have angered the locals. \n\n A few weeks ago, reports emerged that the local Khoshut Oirat population has murdered three Russian traders. Using that event as justification that we have lost control over the region, Russia now demands that we hand over sovereignty of the region immediately. Do we risk war?
Buyeo refusal
As expected, the Buyeo have refused our requests. But do we risk war to enforce our demands?
Buyeo acceptance
As expected, the Buyeo have accepted our requests. Let us build the fort of Veliny to secure our rule over the region!
The Russians back down
As expected, the Russians have backed down. Our rule is supreme!
The treaty of Yarkand

As expected, our troops have handidly beaten the Buyeo. In Yarkand the diplomats gather, and in the end we enforce most of our demands. The area near lake Balkash is ceded to us, and the rest of Xinjiang is partitioned between our Kashgarian puppet, Buyeo Mongolia and the rump state of Xinjiang under nominal Buyeo protection. Let us build the fort of Veliny to secure our rule over the region!
The Russians seize Kashgaria!

The treaty of Yarkand is concluded, and the Russians have enforced their demands. The area near lake Balkash is ceded to Russia, and the rest of Xinjiang is partitioned between the Russian Kashgar puppet, Our Mongolia and the rump state of Xinjiang under our protection. Where do we go from here?
The treaty of Yarkand

Unexpectedly, our troops have been beaten by the Buyeo. In Yarkand the diplomats gather, and in the end the Buyeo enforce most of their demands. The Xinjiang border is agreed upon in favor of the Buyeo,and the Mongol territory that we have seized in the last war needs to be returned. Where do we go from here?
The treaty of Yarkand

As expected, our troops have beaten the Russians. In Yarkand the diplomats gather, and in the end we enforce most of our demands. The Xinjiang border is agreed upon in favor of the locals,and the Mongol territory that the Russians have seized in the last war needs to be returned. This is yet another victory for the Empire!
The Mongolian crisis

Throughout the First and second Oirat wars, the Mongols have staunch vassals of the Buyeo. That seems to be changing. With Siberia growing faster and faster, our economic reach over the Mongol hinterlands have strengthened to the point where we can challenge Buyeo influence. \n\n Seizing this moment, some tribes friendly to us have openly called for independence, and demand our help! We shall send our diplomats over to the Buyeo to discuss the matters.
The Mongolian crisis

Throughout the First and second Oirat wars, the Mongols have staunch vassals to our Emperor. That seems to be changing. With Siberia growing faster and faster, Russian economic reach over the Mongol hinterlands have strengthened to the point where they challenge our influence. \n\n Seizing this moment, some tribes friendly to the Russians have openly called for independence, and have even demanded their help! Not being ones to lose this kind of opportunity, the Russian diplomats have asked us to recognize the Mongols as a co-dominion between us two, but stricter control under them. How do we respond?
Diplomatic channels break down

As with all events past the Urals, the Mongolian crisis has developed faster than we can get reports of. Apparently, those incompetant fools we sent as diplomats have demanded all of Mongolia to be under our control, and the Buyeo have somewhat understandably refused. If we back down now, this would go down as a humiliating event, but going to war would signal that we will back up every call they make to our jingoist far east governors. What shall we do?
An unintended victory in the far east

As with all events past the Urals, the Mongolian crisis has developed faster than we can get reports of. Apparently, those jingoist fools we sent as diplomats have demanded all of Mongolia to be under our control, and the Buyeo have somehow accepted our demands! Now we need to make some tough decisions. Who do we appoint to govern the Mongols and the Oirats, and how do we control him?
Moscow rescinds its diplomats

After we have refused demands from the Russians, news from the west show that this was the right call to make. Apparently, those diplomats have worked outside of official protocal, demanding more from us in search of valor for themselves. Russia has apologized, and promises for more cordial relations between us. While we need more information to figure out what incompetance has led to this, one thing is sure. The Russian far east is full of expansionists, and only vigilant action can stop them.
Deciding the treaty

The war has been won, and we should decide the terms for the war. Originally the war was for the control of the Mongolian horde, so that must be in the terms. However, our jingoistic eastern governors demand more-they seek to take outer Manchuria, lands outside of the Amur and Ussuri rivers, with the port of Hesam included. While seizing Hesam would be a great boon to our eastern provinces, giving yet again to their suggestions might convey a wrong message to our jingoist officers in the military. Do we take the city?
The treaty of Hesam

The war has been lost, and the terms are brutal. Trading rights, control over Mongolia, land concessions, there isn't a single line that was decided in favor of us. Now, even our homelands of Manchuria are under threat. Where do we go from here?
The treaty of Hesam

The treaty of Hesam is concluded, and the Buyeo have enforced their demands. Mongolia is decided to be firmely in their control, and the Stanovoy border is agreed in favor of them. A setback, for sure, but we can recover.
The treaty of Hesam

The treaty of Hesam is concluded, and our demands are included. Mongolia is decided to be firmely in our control, and the Stanovoy border is agreed in favor of us. A minor victory in comparison to our prior defeats, but a victory nonetheless.
TransBaikal is ours!
The war is concluded, and TransBaikal is ours! The Mongol host is pushed south, and our claims over the region is absolute.
Russians seize TransBaikal!
The war is concluded, and the Mongols are punished for our failures. The Russians take the TransBaikal, and the Mongols are understandably furious.
The Buyeo demand
The war is concluded, and the Buyeo return south. The Mongols claim the disputed lands around TransBaikal, and the Altai are free. Was the whole endeavor worth it?
TransBaikal secured!
The war is concluded, and we return south. The Mongols claim the disputed lands around TransBaikal, and the Altai are free. The Barbarians are defeated!
Dummy event!
i wouldn't say freed more like under new management
Imported supplies from Granada
As the civil war rages on, we need more supplies then ever. Thankfully, our orders from the Granadans have arrived
Build the city of Nouadhibou

In the Mauritanian region, cities are few and far between. As such, with minimal investment we can build our center for the region, putting the entirety of Mauritania under our influence. The small fishing village of Nouadhibou seems like the perfect candidate.
Conquest of Inner Mauritania

Inner mauritania must be subjugated if we seek to truly rule Mauritania. As such, we shall send our best soldiers and diplomats to the Berber tribes. They will recognize our sovereignty, once and for all.
Loss of connection to Algeria

After the fall of Tunisia, Our connection to our Algerian tribes have been severed. Sensing an opportunity, they have risen up, demanding an Algerian to rule over them. As we lack any means to respond, all we can do is sit and watch.
The Pearl River Floods

Located on the South of our nation, the Pearl river is one of the longest and largest river in our empire. Flowing in the lands of the Liangguang, the region was recently pacified of rebels. However, our administration hasn't settled in yet. A potentially devastating fact, now that the river has flooded. Thousands of mu of farmland are devastated, and the region is demanding help from us. Quick action must be taken.
Plague and famine spreads

Our devastated provinces in the south are reporting nothing but horrible news. Water-spread diseases are spreading rapidly, and the region is running out of rice. There are already reports of people dying on the streets-and our relief efforts are nowhere to be seen.
The south calms down
The harvests have finally returned to their required numbers, and the epidemics are burning themselves out. We paid a terrible price for this, but the Pearl river region is returning to normalcy.
Taiwan found as source of Opium

Our appointment of Lin Zexu have found significant foundings. The recent flood of Opium in The Yangtse delta originates from the island of Taiwan! \n\n Occupied by rebels and merchants fleeing the war in Bokgun, they have been allured by the riches of the opium trade and since have been sending caskets after caskets in their iconic red junks to our ports. If it wasn't the clean and conscientious Lin zexu, this collusion of merchants and corrupt officials would have been never found! Already there are calls within court to start an expedition to Taiwan and see those peddlers be punished. We must act decisively!
Hausa Rebellion
The predominatly Hausa regions of our realm rebelled against Songhai rule.
They shall not succed!
Segou Revolt
The People of Segou want to overthrow Songhai rule
Its just a City afterall...
The Crimean Khanate

If there is any nation that has been the greates existential threat to Russia, it is the Crimean Khanate. Until we teached them a lesson they will never forget at the battle of Kinburn, They devastated Russian and Lithuanian Ruthenia. Now, as fortifications at the Azov near completion, we have a unique opportunity for us to drive in the final nail in the Crimean coffin. The question is, do we ally with the Lithuanians for this?
The Russian offer
The Russians have come to us with a secret offer
French: They offer us Odessa if we join in their coming war with Crimea. While ending the Crimean Khanate is quite the prospect, are we sure it is better with the Russians expanding at their expense?

English: The Lithuanians agree!
As expected, the Lithuanians have agreed to our offers of Odessa for their army. Now, we march South!
The Lithuanians refuse!
The Lithuanians have refused, probably wary of our expansion. They do not know we can do without them. Now, we march South!
Victory over Crimea

The Turkish intervention forces retreat over the sea. Now, the Crimeans are at our mercy-and we seem to be out of it. The territories shall be incorporated into guvernorates, and the land shall be open for Russian colonization.
Victory over Crimea

The Turkish intervention forces retreat over the sea. Now, the Crimeans are at our mercy-and we seem to be out of it. The territories shall be incorporated into guvernorates, and the land shall be open for Russian colonization. Of course, The Odessan region goes to the Lithuanians.
Beaten back from Crimea
While we haven't lost land, we spent so much blood for so little. How did we lose? Where do we go from here?
The Georgian Crisis

Interesting news has arrived from Georgia. The Ruling prince Dmitri Bagration has been ousted, and the Mukhrani branch has taken over! Prince Bagration wants his lands back, and he has come to us with an offer. He offers us steadfast loyalty if we manage to oust Ivane Mukhrani and protect him from Turkish interference. But do we accept?
The Russians are in Georgia!

There has been a palace coup in Georgia, and the Russians seem like they won't let this opportunity to go to waste. They have invaded from the north, with the exiled prince at their helm. Russians marching south of the Caucusus is never a welcome prospect, but can we risk war with the Russians?
Victory in Georgia
Our forces march through Tbilisi. The Mukhranis seek refuge in Constantinople, and our grip over Georgia is secure. Today is a glorious day!
Defeat in Georgia
Turkish forces march through Tbilisi. The Bagrationis seek refuge in Moscow again, and the Turkish grip over Georgia is secure. Today is a sad day.
Whom to contact?
As we work our way into Azov, we have a decision to make
French: Whom do we contact for its purchace? The City is nominally owned by the Farenikte, a collection of Jewish settlements. They are a workable folk, but will drive a hard bargain for one of their own cities. Alternatively, we could seek "help" from their nominal protectors, the Venetians. With their silence, we could simply demand the settlement outright. Of course, that would be a threatening act, but money is money...

English: A demand over Azov
The Russians have demanded us to hand over Azov, or else! While Azov is an integral part of the nation, this might be our last chance for negotiations...
A deal over Azov
The Russians have secretly demanded us to hand over Azov, unknownst to the Farenikte. While Azov is an integral trading port for our nation, this might be our last chance for negotiations...
A deal over Azov
Success! Our officials are heading to our newest port city, while the Venetians are assured of trading privileges. Russia can now look across the Black sea!
The Disaster in Kyushu

Kyushu has been hit hard by typhoons this summer, yet the convoluted bakufu led by the old shogun seems to be just fine letting the peasants die. The Sangiin of Merchants have decided that we might have to intervene to save the peasants. While this may be technically interfering in the business of the daimyo of Hyuga no Kuni, what harm could a fleet of rice do?
The Disaster in Kyushu

A flurry of reports come from the port of Kagoshima. First, it indicated that the merchant confederation in the southerly isles of Sainantan have sent us a ship of grain to mitigate our severe typhoon season. Then, news came that the samurai bureaucrats of the port and the Sainantan merchants came to a brawl. Next, a Samurai had struck down a merchant with his rights of Kiri-sute gomen for insolence. Finally, there was a battle between the fleets sailors and the port garrison, and our garrison seem to have lost to their superior weapons? \n\n Quick dialogue between cooler heads have stopped this from leading to an acutal war, but the news has shocked the isles. How could have a mob of merchants beaten true Samurai? Do we have to take a look into their weapons?
A battle in Kyushu

The fleet sent to Kagoshima returns with shocking news. First, it indicated that the samurai bureaucrats of the port and our merchants came to a brawl. Next, a Samurai had struck down a merchant with his rights of Kiri-sute gomen for insolence. Finally, there was a battle between the fleets sailors and the port garrison, and our fleet seem to have scored a victory? \n\n Quick dialogue between cooler heads have stopped this from leading to an acutal war, but the news has shocked the isles. How did we win? Is the mainland's army that weak?
The Disaster in Kyushu

A flurry of news come from the port of Kagoshima. First, it indicated that the merchant confederation in the southerly isles of Sainantan have sent Kyushu a ship of grain to mitigate our severe typhoon season. Then, news came that the samurai bureaucrats of the port and the Sainantan merchants came to a brawl. Next, a Samurai had struck down a merchant with his rights of Kiri-sute gomen for insolence. Finally, there was a battle between the fleets sailors and the port garrison, and our garrison seem to have lost to their superior weapons? \n\n Quick dialogue between cooler heads have stopped this from leading to an acutal war, but the news has shocked the isles. How could have a mob of merchants beaten true Samurai? Do we have to take a look into their weapons?
Daimin gokuo

The Emperor's words have kicked off discussion after discussion in the streets. A new brand of scholars calling themselves Civil Confucians have openly talked about how the peasants, farmers, and merchants could have their delegates advise samurai. In response, more and more samurai are responding in violence to silence the upstarts. \n\n While the movement remains minor, we should keep an eye on them. Just for security.
$PROVINCENAME$ Incident

Terrible news from $PROVINCENAME$! A group of samurai have attacked public speakers carrying the banner of Bunmin kounou! While the samurai might have been right to correct those insolent scholars, they might have gone overboard. Already, the public opinion is shifting to their scholars! $PROVINCENAME$ is on the verge of a riot!
A study of Sainantan

In an unprecedented move, the Imperial Court has issued an edict to study and learn from our southern colony of Sainantan of their ways of managing the economy, the society and even their politics. This runs in contravention to the traditional role of the Emperor as a figurehead, is a challenge to the Kyogoku shogunate's power, and may serve to further incite rebellion.
A study of Sainantan

In an unprecedented move, the Imperial Court has issued an edict to study and learn from our southern colony of Sainantan of their ways of managing the economy, the society and even their politics. This runs in contravention to the traditional role of the Emperor as a figurehead, is a challenge to the Kyogoku shogunate's power. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan must decide whether it supports the Emperor's edict or quietly opposes it
A modern constitution for a modern Japan

After our victory over the Tokugawa, we are poised to enact a new constitution never tried before in Asia. 

 Borrowing Heavily from nations such as Venice and the Akino league, this legislation seeks to guarentee equal rights for all peasants to be heard by the emperor. While there are simmers of reactionaries in the countryside, we have shown our military might during the war-no one would want to challenge us again. 

 Right?
Rural areas in open revolt

Terrible news from $PROVINCENAME$! The rural gentry are activly defying and even hindering our efforts of constitutional reform, calling it the Shizan kenpo(The Stillborn constitution) and seeking to replace it by return to tradition. Worse, even the peasantry supposed to support us are at best disturbed at the rapid pace of change. Time will be needed for the rural regions to be stable again.
The Formosa Question

The recent murder of Japanese sailors off the coast of Formosa has given rise to a question within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government: should we use this excuse to step in and wrest control of the southern island? The Line of Advantage is clear, dictating that the land would be invaluable to our goals. But are we willing to risk such a war? Are the risks of Chinese intervention reasonable?
The Formosa Question

The Japanese have come to us with a demand. Apparently, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ subjects have killed Japanese sailors on Formosa, and they demand us to transfer sovereignty of the island immediatly. This will mean war if we refuse... What do we do?
Formosan offers

Formosa has been a quasai-independent state after our conquest of Fujian. The Formosans paid lip service as a province under us, and we haven't bothered to ratify their vassalige. Today, the Formosans ask us for help-apparently the Japanese seek to conquear them? They offer to be an official vassal under our emperor in exchange for military assistance. But do we accept?
Buyeo intervention
As expected, the Buyeo have intervened in affairs between us and Formosa. They will pay for this insolence.
The Treaty of Shimonoseki

The war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ is not going well. The damnable Japanese are in our lands and blockading our ports, and to the embarrassment of our government there seems to be little we can do to stop them. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached us to negotiate a 'fair' settlement -- hand over Formosa and pay reparations. While we could drag the war on and see if the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have the wherewithal to finish their assault, it might be in our best interest to give them what they want, though the loss to our prestige would be considerable.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Agrees

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership has signed our peace treaty, granting us Formosa as well as reparations. This has improved relations between our countries tremendously, and should go a long way to ensuring $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in Asia remains strong.

The Atlantic slave trade, transatlantic slave trade, or Euro-American slave trade involved the transportation by slave traders of various enslaved African people, mainly to the Americas. The slave trade regularly used the triangular trade route and its Middle Passage, and existed from the 16th to the 19th centuries. The majority of those who were enslaved and transported in the transatlantic slave trade were people from Central and West Africa that had been sold by other West Africans to Western European slave traders, while others had been captured directly by the slave traders in coastal raids;[4] Europeans gathered and imprisoned the enslaved at forts on the African coast and then brought them to the Americas.

The Last Xochitl

The Tlaxcalan king, Maxtla Xochitl V, has died at the ripe old age of 79. This would not be worth mentioning if he had heirs, but sadly, he does not, for the barbarous Nahua killed his then 27 year old son in the last great war between our peoples, a war his son only instigated out of grief at the mysterious tasting Nahua corn Maxtla V's grandson last swallowed before he died of some illness. With Maxtla V's body perishes the honorable family that defended us unwaveringly since the humiliating defeat we suffered at the hands of the Nahua ingrates' rebellion. More tragic still, their petty kingdom was all that shielded our great cities of Enekoatlan and Iruna Berea from direct Nahua ambitions. We would keep them as a puppet, but the royal court has no spare sons. All Zakatlan citizens knew this day would happen, yet it is still painful to imagine, our last vassal has finally been annexed...
The Mestizo Gateway

Finally, the traitor to the fatherland, the vile Maxtla Xochitl V, has died. While the dishonorable deaths of his son and grandson were humiliating and controversial amongst our people, it cannot be denied that he more than earned it and that these underhanded tactics contributed greatly to his descent into despair fueled madness. More importantly, with his passing, his lands have been directly annexed into the horrid white state's patrimony. With no vassal treaties to worry about now, this leaves us a golden opportunity to easily march into the Mestizos' foul mountain strongholds and rid our beautiful native lands of their half-white taint once and for all.
The Mexihkan Bloodbath

What was widely believed to be inevitable has finally happened. Our barbarian ex-subjects, the Nahua, have laid claim to our core lands, and loudly proclaim that they will drive us out and create a paradise for all pure-blooded native Kolonbiarrans. We are not disheartened by this news! On the contrary, we welcome it! We yearn to avenge our humiliation by them all those years ago, and we yearn to reverse their desires. We will return to Tenotxtitlan and make it Basque and Christian again, and we will turn this paradise into a land of half-europeans, by any means necessary.

The Kinabatangan Counter-Expedition

After years of undeclared detente, the Arabian Christians have restarted their drive to colonize the coasts of Sabah, recently claiming the fishing village of Semporna. This cannot stand: Sabah is the domain of us Nikkeijin alone, and we will not suffer this insult lightly. A perfect opportunity to show our seriousness to them has, thankfully, appeared, with the discovery of ancient documents tracing the founding of the villages along the Kinabatagan river to a Hokkien adventurer of closer relation to us than these dark-skinned foreigners. We must move quickly to secure the lands of our distant relatives and the valuable bird's nest caves in the region.
Susumeru!
Welsh Offer to Buy Isles of Scilly

In the midst of our current turmoil, yet another diplomatic envoy has sent us a communique. Thankfully they are not declaring yet another state of war against us- yet. Wales, our old trade competitor from the north, has demanded we transfer the Isles of Scilly to their sovereignty. Given our current empire wide secession crisis, this seems a blatant attempt to take advantage of us, as they have only offered a paltry sum in exchange. Still, we must ask ourselves, would it be wise to make yet another enemy?
We need the money to fund campaigns closer to home
We will not bow before those opportunistic scoundrels!
The Genoans Accept!
The Genoans have seen reason and accepted our offer. Though we are a bit less wealthy, what we lose in funds we more than make up for by reuniting our people back into their mouther country.
Llongyfarchiadau!
The War Torn Genoans Have Refused!

Despite our generous offer and indisputable claim to the islands, the Genoans refused to return Scilly to us, even amidst their current national crisis. If we back down, we will look like a paper dragon. We have no choice but to press our claim and liberate our brethren by force.
I Ryfel!
Restore the Welsh Frontier to Offa's Dyke!

Over one thousand years ago, the Mercian king Offa oversaw the construction of a monumental earthwork which still stands to this day. The exact purpose of this barricade is debated among historians, but one purpose it had served for centuries was to delineate the border between England and Wales, both culturally and diplomatically. In the early 1400's, Owen Glendower tried to overthrow this status quo with his treacherous revolt againt the crown, establishing Welsh independence and subsequently pushing the Welsh frontier further inward to the rivers Severn and Mersey. Over four hundred years later we have finally wrought justice upon the treasonous scoundrels of Wales, and now we can restore Herefordshire and Shropshire to their rightful Anglo-Saxon roots.
Take What is Ours
Cernyw Is Ours!

We have achieved what we set to do and liberated Cernyw while simultaneously dooming the absolutist Westminster Loyalists. Whether we will be able to maintain our newly gained territory against the Parliamentary English remains to be seen. In the meantime, we can attempt to legitimize our victory by gaining international recognition through the renaming of English cities to their Welsh translations.
Let Them Dare Try and Take It!
The Fate of Cornwall

Although we have won a glorious victory against the Westminster Absolutists and restored the governance of Parliament to across the southern counties, our victory is not complete. Amidst the nationwide turmoil, the opportunistic Welsh have snuck in and stolen Cornwall from our weaker former foes. They've already tried to justify this to us by bringing up the presence of their Brittonic brethren the Cornish and the assistance they indirectly lent to us during the Civil War. They've offered us plenty of concessions to convince us not to demand the south west peninsula be returned to us, and while these may seem hardly a fair trade for leaving the reconquest of England proper unfinished, we may not be in a position to declare a new war against a fresh enemy. It may be better to use their proposed economic and diplomatic agreements to buy time and prepare for a future liberation of our rightful lands.
What War Exhaustion?
They will loan us the money with which we will fund our rearmament. In five years, we will revisit this issue.
The Anglo-Welsh Trade Agreement Is Up For Renewal

The agreed upon five year duration of the Anglo-Welsh Trade Agreement has elapsed and the treaty is up for renegotions and renewal. This gives us two options: We could negotiate in good faith and extend the deal, or we could use this as a caus belli for the liberation of our lost counties. If we send them terms they would have to refuse, we can blame the break down in communication on them and declare war over this humilation. The only remaining question is whether we've given ourselves enough time to prepare.
We've waited long enough!
That Welsh Econussy Got Me Actin Unwise
Opening of the Padarn Railway

Gwynedd is known for its slate mines, and Dinorwic Quarry is one of the largest. With the abundance of sturdy slate seeping out of the mountains of Wales, the main hurdle has been transportation. Construction was completed today on the Padarn Railway, a 7 mile long, 4 foot narrow gauge rail line from the quarry to Port Dinorwic and one of the first in our nation to take advantage of steam powered traction. Increased haulage provided by the railway will facilitate increased production by the quarry and higher export revenue.
Full Steam Ahead
Talyllyn Railway and Ffestiniog Railway Begin Use of Steam Locomotives

In recent years, slate mine production has shattered records, and this is due in large part to the industrial revolution. Perhaps most important to this process has been the steam engine, both in its stationary and mobile forms. Although stationary steam engines have pumped water out of mines and hauled waggons up steep inclines for decades now, their locomotive cousins have now been refined to a point of relative efficiency and reliability to be widely employable across Walesâ€™ network of narrow gauge tramways. Not only do these miniature railways facilitate the mass transport of slate for export, but the narrow gauges also allow for the transit of passengers to even the most remote of mountainous farms, mills and homesteads. Itâ€™s becoming easier than ever for the people of North Wales to spread out from the coast and civilize the undulating interior.
